website_summaries.verdict: If you want to improve your short game, we like this 3-in-1 net for practicing chipping in the confines of your own yard.
pros: Breaks down easily, and if you're a powerful golfer, the net tends to withstand hitting balls forcefully
cons: Frame can be a little flimsy and needs additional support to hold it down
Turf mat included often rips and/or frays quickly

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a Father's day present, so I didn't purchase this, but i'm really enjoying this product. Other reviews complained about the net and it's sturdiness, I don't agree. I've been hitting balls into the net with a regular hard, full swing and the net is fine. The only problem I'm having is making it stay secure in the ground, which I'll purchase a few more anchors to secure it better. And the mat/ tee pad is made of a strong heavy material. Makes me feel like I'm on the range hitting off the mats. My family made a good choice!
customer_reviews.author: Pastor J.L. Spann,Jr

customer_reviews.title: Practice net not good with any wind.
customer_reviews.text: Practice net works, however, does not hold up under any wind. Even put tent stakes in ground to hold down. Also had to duck tape cross members at top to keep in place. Would not buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Kermit D. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job. I have bought three of these
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job. I have bought three of these. For myself and two sons. Suggestions: put in a non windy area and add a support line to the back. Also use tent stakes. Then works great.
customer_reviews.author: EdNH

customer_reviews.title: Ok design.  Setup requires to 2 people.  Can't hit driver into net.
customer_reviews.text: I used this net for the first time today after ordering it almost 3 years ago. Setup was ok, not great. Much easier with 2 people (as the instructions recommends). I hit a bunch of 7-9 irons into it. Then I teed up a driver and first drive ends up going right through the net and then who knows where. really disappointed that this didn't hold and now I can't send it back because it has been too long. 8-(
customer_reviews.author: Justin Morabito

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this net for 2 years and I live in Las Vegas. It’s been a really sturdy addition to my yard. I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: jason geyer

customer_reviews.title: Great equipment!
customer_reviews.text: Great items to use for practicing your swings. Easy to set up, bonus is the chipping basket.
customer_reviews.author: AJMORT

customer_reviews.title: ie=UTF8&psc=1 I'm happy with the purchase - it will probably only last ...
customer_reviews.text: This net takes about 30m to assemble and familiarize yourself with the design of the crossed beams, the way the pins fit into the bottom of the beams, and the need for additional replacement stakes to hold the net down in the wind. I had a beam crack next to a joint, but as another reviewer mentioned - you can just knock out the broken piece with a pencil, and reconnect the beam into the joint. I found these tent stakes did the trick:  I'm happy with the purchase - it will probably only last 1-2 seasons, but for the price point, it's okay.
customer_reviews.author: stingman

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Thos was the worst 3 in one net set I've ever had the misfortune to purchase. First off the chipping net and the driving net are not designed the way the diagram say. Since when do you have a driving net the is oval, on stead of square like the diagram. There is no green tarp on the bottom. And lastly the pegs are too short. Do ever buy this. Go to Walmart or Dicks Sporting Goods first.
customer_reviews.author: Huggybear

customer_reviews.title: A few uses, then flaps seams busted!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so my high school age daughter could use during quarantine in the backyard. She used the net five times, then the seam below flap where the poles go through on the top of the net just plain fell apart/ripped. What a total disappointment. Poor quality. A product where you are suppose to hit golf balls into should withstand a certain amount of force and have durability. She is very upset. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Nice setup for backyard practice
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to set up but is easiest with two people. The hitting mat with three tee heights is good. Don’t know how durable it is since we just got it.
customer_reviews.author: Clgraham

customer_reviews.title: Tough and fun
customer_reviews.text: Not the easiest to put up for us mechanical challenge people. My wife finally figured it out after an hour. Videos don't help, and the instructions are weak. Once it is up, awesome.
customer_reviews.author: James42

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Read reviews of product before purchase, and some people said they can hit driver through net.I bought it thinking about using those limited flight practice balls. When I got it I "put it thru its paces" with real golf balls and was pleasantly surprised. Those people need to get a swing coach and go on tour or enter long drive competitions. Perhaps they got a Monday morning or Friday afternoon model. All I know is I'm 6'1" 230lb can drive it 300yds and tried to hit it thru net with all I had and didn't get thru once. Maybe when the net ages, but for now no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Good for backyard fun!
customer_reviews.text: Fun golf training set. We are having a ball playing in the backyard. Sturdy enough for pretty much any skill level...but we use the foam practice balls! Can't speak to how this would hold up to real golf balls. Don't forget to buy a little contraction to shag balls it's worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Hollingsworth

customer_reviews.title: We do like this set but we were disappointed that on the ...
customer_reviews.text: We do like this set but we were disappointed that on the third swing, a chunk of the astro turf on the mat came flying off. Of course Amazon was happy to accept a return, but disassembling this big net, fitting it all back into the bag, shipping, getting the replacement, setting it up again....that's a lot of hassle! I was hoping I could just get a replacement mat but I can't seem to figure out who to contact to make that request.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it so do I
customer_reviews.text: My kid loves it, he’ll even I hit into. Needs a bigger mat to hit from but for the price it’s great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The separate chipping net is a nice bonus that I use with real golf balls
customer_reviews.text: Works well for backyard practice. I use it with foam golf balls. The separate chipping net is a nice bonus that I use with real golf balls.
customer_reviews.author: Ka Bao Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great for quarantine times!
customer_reviews.text: Love this.. great for golfers that can’t go to the golf course! Old and young.. I have a 12, 55 and 87 year olds using it!
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi Barron

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy, not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea, but very flimsy and blows over with any small bit of wind. The pieces given to hold it down are useless.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is great for my daughter to practice. Now her grandpa does, too!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S York

customer_reviews.title: Having fun
customer_reviews.text: I got this about 2 weeks ago, it was not that easy to put together. I found the direction were a little vague. I figured it out myself. I haven't got a chance to use the chipping net yet since it is still to cold here in PA. For the price it is nice. I am using it in my garage. I also got an ES 12 Launch Monitor and have been hitting balls to see about distances. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Strobert

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality. Good design. Do Not Buy.
customer_reviews.text: Great design, no quality. Set up fairly quickly (10 minutes). Started hitting a 5 iron and notic d a couple balls flying. After looking close noticed multiple holes already. Definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the money. When other nets cost hundreds more and this one works great. I hit a driver into it and it stopped every ball.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up
customer_reviews.text: This product works great, though it was a challenge for 3 of us to put together. The illustrated instructions (with very few words) are not very helpful. Once together, the product worked great. However, the stakes used bent easily. We had some wind come through and one of the fiberglass poles snapped just below a connection point. My husband is in the process of trying to fix it. In all, we've had it less than one month and only been able to use it a few times. If I thought we could return it, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Doorboard

customer_reviews.title: Low quality net
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to blow a hole through the net with a driver. I used it for a couple weeks before I put the first hole in it. Also, over time some of the stitching came loose around the nylon channels the poles go through. There are much better quality nets available out there for a few bucks more.
customer_reviews.author: natlight

customer_reviews.title: Great net, but don't lose the instructions
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice net combination that has the chipping net, hitting net, practice mat, and carrying bag. It is very portable and durable. The only complaint that I have is that someone not as handy as myself may have trouble with the setup of the larger net, especially if they were to lose the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Firanek

customer_reviews.title: 3 in 1 golf practice / training net
customer_reviews.text: You folks are awesome!! The product arrived very rapidly in perfect condition. The price is worth every penny. I will start golf training in my own back yard now!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ray E.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I use this alot, just to keep my swing in check.....
customer_reviews.author: Annie Parm

customer_reviews.title: Easily Tipped
customer_reviews.text: The slightest breeze tips it over. Additional straps or poles are needed in order to maintain an upright structure.
customer_reviews.author: Des

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Having a great time by myself. Lol. Practice, practice, practice. I use it in my back yard.
customer_reviews.author: papichulo

customer_reviews.title: On time as advertised. This is not a stand ...
customer_reviews.text: On time as advertised.This is not a stand alone item be prepared to tie it down. Not sure how it will stand the test of time used for a couple hours couple balls went through netting. Overall, as a beginner it works for me for now
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This product looks nice. However it CANNOT stand on its own. Steer clear of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a quality net so far. Just make sure and use foam practice balls when not chipping (my 5 year old uses real golf balls) The reason I only give it 3 stars: 1. The net is always on the ground from the wind 2. You might not need 2 chipping (the net comes with a chipping target already)
customer_reviews.author: ez

customer_reviews.title: Sweet practice net.
customer_reviews.text: Main driving net was bigger than I expected which is good. The additional chipping net in my opinion is useless but it's cool to have. Its essentially a net with tent poles. Easy to put up, nice and flexible in strong wind. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: (AS)Jami

customer_reviews.title: Some good, some bad!
customer_reviews.text: Two of the three components are of good quality. The tee/turf mat ripped easily however. We had to glue it back together.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Parzych

customer_reviews.title: elastic string slipped out
customer_reviews.text: Elastic string came out of rod segment during assembly. cobbled it together but unnecessarily complicated.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina A. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Well, what can I say...
customer_reviews.text: You cannot hit regulation golf balls at full strength into this net because the balls will go through the netting. You need to use special practice balls. If you can augment the backdrop with a sheet of heavy gauge plastic or a tarp of some kind that may make it more usable. It's not easy to put up and take down so I'd find an area where you can put it up and leave it up if possible...
customer_reviews.author: Klipster

customer_reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY THE WORST DESIGN
customer_reviews.text: No way!! What a waste of money, time and effort. Go buy a better one at your local golf shop. And make sure it's made in America.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter....she was able to set it up by herself after we figured it out the first time. She uses regular gold balls in it and has had no problems at all. At full swing this thing didn't go anywhere! For sure a good deal. The chipping net is a little EH....but she still uses it.
customer_reviews.author: zkisbell

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality support
customer_reviews.text: Hard to put up, doesn’t stay firm. Had to reinforce it to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to setup and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible. The net never stays up. It’s hard the get setup. Any wind at all and it falls over. The pins to keep the net anchored in the ground are so small they constantly pull out.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D Burnside

customer_reviews.title: You got what you paid for...
customer_reviews.text: This is, of course, the lowest price you can find online. You should pay more for better quality. The rubber mat and plastic tee were already broken after a few swings... If your swing speed is really high, this is not right for you. The chipping net and driving net are OK. You get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Great service
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Bought for my husband for an early father's day gift. The net got messed up from the wind. My husband asked about a replacement net and they sent a replacement right away. A++++ .great service
customer_reviews.author: Lisa c.

customer_reviews.title: P. O. S. Literally, the first ...
customer_reviews.text: P.O.S. Literally, the first swing I took broke the tee, burned the rug and the ball knocked down the net it came with. Stay away!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: chirogolf

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great fast setup and good value for the price
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Net works great!
customer_reviews.text: Net easy to set up, but does take 2 people. Net works very well. A bit too big to fit in our garage if I put the car in with the net! Net in target tore after a few days of use. I would recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Rode

customer_reviews.title: Broke the first week
customer_reviews.text: This is laying in a pile in my backyard. I set it up, hit a few balls and was fairly happy with everything. Then, during a storm, I watched a "strong" wind snap one of the support beems. Now... it is worthless. 90 bucks down the drain. There is no way this should have happened.
customer_reviews.author: JTarsney

customer_reviews.title: Backyard net
customer_reviews.text: This product is great..i shopped around for a while and this was the best bang for your buck. Very sturdy and it comes with anchors for the grass to hold it down. The chipping net is perfect and it all folds up into a carrying bag. The fairway green and T work great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: fun activity
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son who doesnt have a huge back yard but loves to golf. He will be able to use this and in the back yard most of the year. Easy set up and packs away into a nice carry bag. Appears to be sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Wi

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Set up - the support rod broke - what now - can't return as past 30 days (didn't put up until last week). Left holding the bag!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Lombardi

customer_reviews.title: Very Frustrated :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his FIRST Father's Day. After first use one of the bars splintered and ripped the fabic. Now it doesn't work anymore. Very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney K.

customer_reviews.title: For Grandson
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our grandson and it was perfect! He is able to practice his swing and we do not loose all the balls. Only down side was the driving mat...........really cheap! However for the price I was able to purchase another driving mat at Walmart. Would recomend this item
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Well made, and i use it all the time.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I hit real golf balls at full force and balls do NOT go through the net... I love it. Takes a helping hand to set up,, if you have someone, , if not, you can manage
customer_reviews.author: crystal asher

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: Neat product! My son really liked it however it does not stay upright very well!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Everything is good except the first hit broke the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Seed

customer_reviews.title: so...........so
customer_reviews.text: its not the easiest to set up for a single person . the mat and tee are of poor quality . the tee broke after just 5 doz hits. switched to the foam balls to try and protect the net from tearing.
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: All poles were shipped broken
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase ever. All poles were shipped broken. By the time I opened the box the warranty had expired. I ended up with 75 dollars down the drain. The net also had large holes in it...had
customer_reviews.author: John dobrowolski

customer_reviews.title: What a pain in the neck to set up. ...
customer_reviews.text: What a pain in the neck to set up. If you set it up, might as well leave it up, I wanted to take it down out of the rain to make it last longer,, but not gonna do it.
customer_reviews.author: snake61

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase for the price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my boyfriend and he loves it. He uses it everyday. It was very simple to set up and dissemble so you can take it wherever you go. The only this is if he drives to hard into it I get nervous because the whole things seems to tilt a little, but never falls.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie R.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. No issues setting it up and have enjoyed practicing with it. We have already had one competition with the target and as usual my husband won.
customer_reviews.author: Bathtub Reader

customer_reviews.title: THIS ITEM WILL BREAK IF WINDY!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase if you live in a windy area. I bought this last month and have been waiting for nice weather so my daughter can start practicing. I set this up in my back yard and anchored it down with the small stakes provided. Within the hour a gust of wind snapped the end section of the pole which is unrepairable.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my neighbors safe!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my back yard every day in my desert landscaping (rocks!) and it works great. I bought a 3'x5' hitting mat, though, because the little one that comes with this is not very useful.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great for th price.
customer_reviews.text: Great devices for the price. Shaved 3 strokes off my handicap because I can use this every day in my backyard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money...
customer_reviews.text: The item does assemble easily but, we get some winds here in Afghanistan and it is difficult to keep it standing. Beyond that, the Marines and I get great play out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger L Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great Practice Net!
customer_reviews.text: I was going to initially shell out for the Callaway one but was like over $200 so I bought the next best one under $100. This net is actually HUGE but I love it as it's big enough for you to try different shots. As a pro golfer, I finally can practice and keep my swing in tact without having to go to the range all the time. This is great since I work from home, I can just hit golf balls in my backyard any time I want, plus chipping net is also awesome. Definitely a great value, better than the ones you find at Target or Wal-mart, which I used to use.
customer_reviews.author: Max Lee

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: I have this setup in my garage ... I pull the cars out, move it away from the wall ... place the turf and mirror and I am ready to practice setup, swing and dealing with less than perfection ;]
customer_reviews.author: Alfred Renewedman

customer_reviews.title: Ok but one of the poles just broke after a few weeks.  But was replaced just as fast!
customer_reviews.text: Product seems fine and works well. but one of the segmented poles broke at the coupling. Not too hard to fix. I just removed the broken inch of the pole and added some glue and re-inserted it in the coupling. I'll see if they send me a replacement as I'm just starting the warranty claim today. In less than a day the seller contacted me via email and offered to replace the pole. I had the replacement in less that a week. Great Job taking care of the customer... One day later and I had an email from the company saying they would send me a new pole. That's GREAT service! I'll let you know then I get the replacement.
customer_reviews.author: workbench

customer_reviews.title: GREAT HOBBY AT WORK
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS AN AWESOME STUFF. I LOVE TO PLAY THIS AT WORK. WORKS GREAT AND HAVING SO MUCH FUN..! THANKS
customer_reviews.author: Katheryn Lee

customer_reviews.title: The damn thing broke after putting it together.
customer_reviews.text: I would like to return it and buy a different similar product that is more sturdy. How can I do so?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Driving Net and Bag
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandson and he is pleased with it. He said it is helping to improve his swing and hitting the balls. He also wanted it to use at home before he goes to golf at the range.
customer_reviews.author: Choctaw Jane

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and I use it in my basement
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Sturdy and I use it in my basement. Happy with my choice
customer_reviews.author: Linda Timme

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell
customer_reviews.text: Hitting pad came damaged / torn and missing two tie down tent posts pins. Now I wonder what the over/ under is of how many ball strikes the net will withstand .
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Backyard
customer_reviews.text: This was a solid buy, it looks even better than I thought it would and I would definitely recommend it to a friend, prime delivery was quick as well.
customer_reviews.author: J Madison

customer_reviews.title: , was great until sticks started to break,
customer_reviews.text: The net is fine but after using it for 2 spring season, the sticks have fallen apart. I tried to find replacement sticks online but could not, it was too much money to use for 2 seasons
customer_reviews.author: rima

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I had a single net and this unit is good for me and my grand children who are just starting. Like the target as it gives them visual reward when the hit the ball on target.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E Geib

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap material for the poles. Broken at the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap material for the poles. Broken at the link between pole segments at the first time use immediately when a golf ball strikes on it.
customer_reviews.author: Qiyu

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is great for practicing in the yard. You do not have to chase golf balls everyplace!!
customer_reviews.author: Tony S

customer_reviews.title: cannot be used in moderate winds. and in texas ...
customer_reviews.text: cannot be used in moderate winds. and in texas it's always windy. rubber tee ripped off after hitting about 10 balls. the one i gave my son had one pole to break in moderate winds, 15 to 20 mph winds.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn L Powell

customer_reviews.title: VERY PLEASED AND ENTERTAINED!
customer_reviews.text: This came in the mail quick and easy to set up, we have it in the backyard for practice and we are enjoying it very much!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Reaves

customer_reviews.title: Why
customer_reviews.text: It`s` ok after it is up, it takes two people to assemble and holding it up it dosen`t stand up very well I had to pound and tie steel rebar on each side of the net in order for the net to stand up also I tied two string behind the net to my fence in orde for the net to hold up against the wind and ball strikeing, on a 1 to 10 for me is a 5.
customer_reviews.author: joseph caturegli

customer_reviews.title: Over hauling your Swing
customer_reviews.text: Great for practicing your swing, it is working great. Practicing with the irons 7 true 4 helps 80% while playing. Recommend this net for golfers that can not play in the winter because of cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: will work
customer_reviews.text: little flimiserly than i thought. still ok it will work. wanted more free standing. the best is the small chipping net, can have in small area
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This was a great gift for my husband. The whole family uses it and we have a great time.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great practice tool!
customer_reviews.text: The 3 in 1 Golf Practice Set has a mat, driving net and a chipping net. This makes for a complete practice. This set is a very good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Millie S. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: good product. chipping net not used
customer_reviews.text: grandson uses daily. good product. chipping net not used. seems to stop balls very well.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made and the instructions didn't go into detail at all. you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I can't always run out to the golf course. This is perfect for practice. It's quite durable and arrived on time
customer_reviews.author: Sincerely

customer_reviews.title: Do not use driver
customer_reviews.text: Do not use inside or near other houses with your driver. I drove a hole right through the netting. Thank god i brought it to a field for first use. Iron use is great though.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Plocharczyk

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: fell apart when trying to assemble, stitching failed at 2 places
customer_reviews.author: Jay Howard

customer_reviews.title: Practice Net
customer_reviews.text: My son loves it - uses it everyday after work. Easy to setup, better to have somewhere to put it so you're not having to take it down and put it back up again.
customer_reviews.author: Tank 560

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for 12 year old son. He used for one month. I bought him a new driver and he hit one shot into and the net toppled over and one of the legs broke. I don't recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a net I could hit baseballs into, kick and through footballs into, and hits some baseballs. This net can't handle it. The write up here says it can be used for a variety of sports. When I opened the box and read the instructions, it specifically states that it is for golf only. It can't handle a football being thrown into or kicked into it. I was looking for something I could hit some baseballs into, but I doubt it would hold up. The write also says it can be setup in two minutes. Try 10 or 15 minutes. I hope I can return this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is a great practice net
customer_reviews.text: 2nd net I purchased, this is a great practice net. Its well made and looks like it will holdup
customer_reviews.author: jzavagno

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: showed up quickly and was in excellent condition. Works great for myself and my two boys 8 & 6 love being able to swing full stroke into the net while connecting to a real ball
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hutton

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: This item was just as it was described- I gave this item as a gift and the recipient loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great Overall product.
customer_reviews.text: So far I have managed to put a hole in the small chipping target net but I imagine I should take it down when hitting my driver. This product is great however, and allows my kids and I to hit balls at home without having to pay for a driving range.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: I think the only thing my son did not love about this is that the mat that came with ...
customer_reviews.text: I think the only thing my son did not love about this is that the mat that came with it isn't very sturdy. He had it ripped up with one mis-swing.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Wells

customer_reviews.title: The green fake grass comes off easily. It literally came off in pieces by the ...
customer_reviews.text: The green fake grass comes off easily. It literally came off in pieces by the end of the first week. Other than that everything seems to be working great. Had it a little over 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Durham

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for any golfer!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this net to practice my golf technique. Set up very quickly with included instructions, essentially being two "tent" poles that go through plastic sleeves (make sure not to rip the plastic while pushing the poles through). The netting looks like good quality to me. After hitting about 2 or 3 dozen balls with all of my clubs, I am completely satisfied. As a side note, if you are afraid of putting a hole in the net (like some of the previous reviews state), you can buy foam practice balls that feel like real golf balls.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good training set.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for training in my garden. It is sturdy and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: big mistake!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product!!!!!! Mine didn't even last one day. A little breeze tore the fabric. Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Wade Mathis

product_meta.title: 3 in 1 Golf Practice Set
product_meta.description:
3-in-1 golf practice set with driving net, chipping net, and driving mat Driving net's 2 expandable fiberglass poles extend to 11 x 7 x 5.5 feet (W x H x D) Weather-resistant 23-by-26-inch chipping net functions indoors or outdoors Driving mat with high-quality nylon artificial grass surface and heavy-duty rubber base All items break down for storage in weather-resistant nylon carrying bag

AMAZON.COM
Practice your driving, chipping, and approach shots without heading to the driving range with this three-in-one golf practice set. Equipped with a driving net, chipping net, driving mat, and nylon carrying bag, the set includes everything you need to hone your golf game in your backyard. The set starts with the easy-to-set-up driving net, which includes two expandable fiberglass poles that extend to 11 by 7 by 5.5 feet (W x H x D). Simply place the 1-by-2-foot driving mat in front of the driving net and swing away. The mat's high-quality nylon artificial grass surface and heavy-duty rubber base feel authentic, so you can line up your shots with confidence. (The mat includes both a fairway-like surface and a tee.) The driving net's large opening, meanwhile, will catch both straight drives and mis-hits, so you needn't worry about breaking your neighbor's window. 

 The kit also comes with a weather-resistant 23-by-26-inch chipping net that takes up far less space than the driving net. With the chipping net, you can practice your pitches and chips in a relatively small space, including indoors. And should you want to practice at the park or while traveling, the kit breaks down and stores in a weather-resistant nylon carrying bag. Custom tailored to accommodate the complete practice set, the bag is ideal for transport and storage. You can also use the driving net to practice select golf, soccer, and baseball skills.
feature_bullets: 3-in-1 golf practice set with driving net, chipping net, and driving mat
Driving net's 2 expandable fiberglass poles extend to 11 x 7 x 5.5 feet (W x H x D)
Weather-resistant 23-by-26-inch chipping net functions indoors or outdoors
Driving mat with high-quality nylon artificial grass surface and heavy-duty rubber base, Velcro has been intentionally removed and the length of the sleeve increased to make the assembly easier
All items break down for storage in weather-resistant nylon carrying bag
